Pizza Module

pizza.py

This module defines a Pizza class, which represents a pizza with its attributes (crust, sauce, cheese, toppings) and calculates its total cost based on selected options.

class src.pizza.Pizza(crust, sauce, cheese, toppings)

Bases: object

Represents a pizza and calculates its cost based on selected crust, sauce, cheese, and toppings.

__init__(crust, sauce, cheese, toppings)

Initialize a pizza with crust, sauce, cheese, and toppings.

Parameters:

  • crust (str) – Type of crust (e.g., “thin”, “thick”, “gluten free”)

  • sauce (list[str]) – List of sauces (e.g., [“marinara”, “pesto”])

  • cheese (str) – Type of cheese (e.g., “mozzarella”)

  • toppings (list[str]) – List of toppings (e.g., [“mushrooms”, “pepperoni”])

__str__()

Return a string representation of the pizza.

Returns:

A formatted string with pizza details.

Return type:

str

cost()

Calculate the total cost of the pizza based on its crust, sauce, and toppings.

Returns:

The calculated cost of the pizza.

Return type:

int

get_cost()

Return the current cost of the pizza.

Returns:

The pizza cost.

Return type:

int

set_cost(cost)

Set the cost of the pizza explicitly.

Parameters:

cost (int) – The new cost to assign to the pizza.

Raises:

ValueError – If the cost is not a non-negative integer.
